meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inconvenient.
meanings.sent1: The inconveniency of having to wait in long lines at the store can be frustrating.
meanings.sent2: Carrying heavy bags while walking home was an inconveniency.
meanings.sent3: The inconveniency of forgetting your umbrella on a rainy day is always a hassle.
meanings.sent4: The inconveniency of a broken phone felt like a weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The inconveniency of a slow internet connection made her work unbearable.

meanings.definition: Something that causes trouble or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Losing his keys was a major inconveniency for him.
meanings.sent2: The flat tire on the way to work was an inconveniency she didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The inconveniency of a noisy neighbor kept him up at night.
meanings.sent4: The inconveniency of a power outage during the storm was challenging.
meanings.sent5: The inconveniency of a canceled flight disrupted their travel plans.
